meanings.sent1: The cowboys corralled the horses at sunset.
meanings.sent2: The rancher corralled all the sheep before the storm.
meanings.sent3: The children corralled their toys in the playroom before bedtime.
meanings.sent4: The teacher corralled the students for the field trip.
meanings.sent5: The volunteers corralled the donations for the charity event.

meanings.definition: Placed in a pen or enclosure (verb)
meanings.sent1: The farmer corralled the chickens in the coop.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper corralled the elephants for feeding time.
meanings.sent3: The magician corralled the rabbits in the hat for the grand finale.
meanings.sent4: The park ranger corralled the bears in a safe area of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The pet owner corralled the puppies in the backyard for playtime.
